definition: (prefix indicating ordinal number, e.g. first, number two etc)/order/(old) rank in the imperial examinations/mansion/(literary) but/just

sentences.english: Next day he comes by again, and she brags that she didn't dream of him.
sentences.chinese: 第二天，他又來了，她嘲笑根本沒有夢到他。

sentences.english: It becomes second nature to adapt your own style to that of the person with whom you are speaking.
sentences.chinese: 這成爲將你的風格與談話者相適應的第二天性。

sentences.english: The next day the hunter lured the quails with his quail call as usual.
sentences.chinese: 第二天，獵人照常利用叫聲來引誘鵪鶉。

sentences.english: This is the second day now that I do not know the result of the juegos, he thought.
sentences.chinese: 這是聯賽的第二天，可我不知道比賽的結果如何。

sentences.english: Let's say that your test at school is happening the next day.
sentences.chinese: 假設第二天學校就要考試了。

sentences.english: On the day succeeding the fire, I visited the ruins.
sentences.chinese: 失火的第二天，我去查看那堆廢墟。

sentences.english: At three-fifteen the following afternoon, Persky worked his wizardry again.
sentences.chinese: 第二天下午三點十五分，帕斯基再次施展魔法。

sentences.english: The next day, Kenzo was killed and Akimi disappeared.
sentences.chinese: 第二天，健三被殺身亡，雅美也不見了蹤影。

sentences.english: When Gaston arose in the morning, his wife had already departed.
sentences.chinese: 第二天早上加斯頓起牀的時候，他的妻子已經離開了。

sentences.english: I was going to see Mrs. Ked the next day, but the appointment has been cancelled.
sentences.chinese: 我本打算第二天去看基德先生，但是約會被取消了。

sentences.english: The next morning they were summoned to see the commanding general.
sentences.chinese: 第二天早上，將軍召見他們。

sentences.english: The next morning, he asks the monks what the sound was, but they say, "We can't tell you."
sentences.chinese: 第二天一大早，男子就問和尚，那聲音是啥呀。

sentences.english: But for the second day in a row, banking stocks in particular faced a rough ride.
sentences.chinese: 不過，在歐洲股市上，金融股連續第二天遭遇困境。

sentences.english: By the next day, Cindel was much better.
sentences.chinese: 第二天，辛德爾就好多了。

sentences.english: Next morning the little man wakes the woman up.
sentences.chinese: 第二天小矮人把美女叫醒。

sentences.english: Around 11:30 on the second day, the food trolley came around again.
sentences.chinese: 大概第二天的11點半鐘，食品小車兒又來啦。

definition: at dawn/at first light/first thing in the morning
first thing in the morning/at daybreak
